intro: [WRONG START] Mariałva macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved marialva, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and riparian zones. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
